p: The terpenoid, β-pinene, in the leaves of A. africana possesses significant anti-inflammatory properties [ 2, 19]. The anti-inflammatory activity may be attributed to its potential to suppress mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) and nuclear factor-kappa B (NF- κB) pathways, making it an important compound in the treatment of inflammatory diseases [ 2, 45]. α-Pinene is also thought to contribute to wound healing by suppression of inflammatory reactions triggered by tissue injury [ 19, 30].
